result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin M. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other probation now serving

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  No contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person with Nick Thorson.  Must have no access to any financial information of another person except for your own.
Defendant may apply for expungement if probation successfully completed and all court obligations are satisfied.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  May petition for early release after 2 years if compliant with all conditions of probation.  Must comply with any other recommendations of probation agent.

of 5/4/15 plea hearing notice.  Moved left no address.  UTF, RTS
DNA Proof of Submission form signed by JASO Official
Destroyed fingerprint cards
Copy of signed  DNA Proof of Submission form

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD William Poss.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  DA Fox states there is no restitution and victim notification has been complied with.  Joint recommendation for plea and sentencing.  He previously plead to 14CF47 - only needs sentencing on this case.  Judge reviewed charges/penalties/waiver of rights/elements.  Guilty pleas entered as follows:  14CF189 Count 1, amended to Misd. bailjumping - Guilty plea; 15CM25, Counts 1 & 2 - Guilty pleas; 14CF192, Counts 1 amended to misd. theft & Count 2 - Guilty pleas with Count 3 dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant understands the proceedings, pleas are entered and rights waived knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently.  Defendant is found guilty of charges as amended or stated.  Defendant speaks.  Sentence recommendation is adopted and ordered:  Probation for 3 years on each count/case concurrent with following conditions:    Defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant may apply for expungment if probation successfully completed and all court obligations are satisfied.  Defendant may also petition for early release after 2 years if complaint with all probation requirements.  No contact allowed with Nick Thorson.  No access allowed to any financial information of another person except for your own.  Must pay the costs of the action including the DNA surcharge and must supply a DNA sample.
Plea hearing at 05-04-2015 01:30 pm

This bond includes 14CF92, 14CF189 and 15CM25 and 14CF47:  Cooperate with any mental health evaluations requested by your Attorney or family.    No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: Mother  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed/Take all medications as prescribed to you.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  Juvenile victim.  Must reside at mother's residence.  Must attend school without any unexcused abscences or tardies.  Must take all psychotropic medications exactly as prescribed.  Medications must be monitored by a 3rd party.  Must report to Jackson County Human Services by Friday, March 21 by noon for a global needs assessment.
